revised_title: Selective Conductivity in Plant and Animal Nerve: Influence of Homodromous and Heterodromous Electric Currents
tldr: The author investigates the influence of homodromous and heterodromous electric currents on the transmission of excitation in both plant and animal nerve. The study demonstrates that excitation is better conducted against the direction of the current, suggesting a selective or preferential direction of conductivity for excitation.
